<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/24/microsoft-hits-2t-market-cap-shows-off-major-windows-update?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When One Door Closes, Microsoft Windows Opens
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/24/microsoft-hits-2t-market-cap-shows-off-major-windows-update?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a white window with blue paned glass in front of a yellow background. The top four panes are made to look like Microsoft's slanted, rectangular Windows logo, and peeping out through the open part of the window is a swirly blue background." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTQ4L21pY3Jvc29mdF93aW5kb3dzXzExLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft was incorporated 40 years ago today, but instead of installing a barn door in its master bathroom, the company closed above a $2 trillion market cap for the first time this week and <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/24/22546791/microsoft-windows-11-announcement-features-updates?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> its first major Windows update in years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Windows 11 is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/microsoft-unveil-first-new-windows-six-years-2021-06-24/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">adding support</a> for Android apps on its laptops and PCs for the first time and incentivizing developers to put their apps in the Microsoft Store by giving them 100% of revenues from app sales—a swipe at Apple's and Google's 30% fees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other updates that should be ready by the time you break out douglas fir candles include....</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An upgraded interface </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Features for multitasking and working across multiple screens </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A direct integration with its messaging/collaboration platform, Teams</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New gaming features, including an Xbox Game Pass integration</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Not your grandma's operating system</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, actually it is. 35 years after it was first introduced, Windows <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-still-needs-windows-to-shine-11624556362?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remains a core part</a> of Microsoft's business and is the world's most popular desktop OS. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over 1.3 billion users run Windows 10, CEO Satya Nadella disclosed in May, and the division is expected to bring in $23 billion this year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, it can be easy to forget Microsoft is the second-biggest publicly traded company behind Apple. Because of its focus on business software, the company has generally escaped the antitrust scrutiny that lawmakers have leveled on its more consumer-facing peers Facebook, Amazon, Apple, and Google in recent years.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">...until now? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Six bills that could reshape antitrust law in the US cleared a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/24/technology/antitrust-overhaul-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major hurdle</a> yesterday morning. And during debate on one pertaining to data portability, the committee specifically <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/24/us-house-panel-votes-to-give-antitrust-enforcers-more-money-in-big-tech-session.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">discussed</a> whether the bill had been altered so Microsoft wouldn't fall under its purview. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>These antitrust bills are still in their infancy, but “the House is going faster and farther against tech than anyone expected,” Cowen and Company's Paul Gallant told the NYT. Microsoft, though, doesn't appear to be a priority. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INFRASTRUCTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/24/president-biden-group-bipartisan-senators-reach-infrastructure-deal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Great News on Infrastructure: No One Got Exactly What They Wanted
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/24/president-biden-group-bipartisan-senators-reach-infrastructure-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Presidential candidate Joe Biden next to an Amtrak train " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODg3L2pvZV9iaWRlbl9hbXRyYWsuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Someone must have ordered stuffed-crust pizza during negotiations, because President Biden <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/24/infrastructure-deal-talks-biden-invites-bipartisan-senators-to-white-house.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday that he and a bipartisan group of senators agreed to a deal that would put a fresh coat of paint on the country's infrastructure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both sides compromised to reach an agreement. While Biden's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/biden-releases-23-trillion-infrastructure-plan-boost-us-competitiveness-combat-climate-change?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">original proposal</a> called for $2.3 trillion to combat climate change and overhaul roads, trains, and broadband, the new plan is the stripped-down, acoustic version:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It'll cost $1.2 trillion over eight years with $579 billion in new spending.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The president called it the “largest investment in public transit in American history.” It certainly would be the largest investment into Amtrak since the creation of Amtrak.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some spending on child and elder care as well as education was cut from Biden's original plan. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A corporate tax rate increase to fund the plan, which Biden originally proposed, was also ditched.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>don't start daydreaming about good train wi-fi yet, the plan still has a ways to go to become law. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said her chamber would only take up the infrastructure plan if Democrats were able to push through a separate spending package. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/24/buzzfeeds-got-spac-values-media-company-15-billion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pick a Color and We'll Tell You How to IPO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/24/buzzfeeds-got-spac-values-media-company-15-billion?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Buzzfeed logo with text lingo: Lol, win, cute, wtf, omg" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTUwL2J1enpmZWVkX2xvZ28ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>BuzzFeed</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You'll finally be able to own a piece of the media company that owns a serious chunk of your screen time (we're reusing that line when we IPO). Yesterday, BuzzFeed <a href="https://fortune.com/2021/06/24/buzzfeed-to-go-public-with-1-5-billion-spac-deal/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed plans</a> to go public via SPAC.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory</strong>: BuzzFeed was founded by CEO Jonah Peretti in 2006 and listicled its way to hundreds of millions in funding from the likes of NBCUniversal. In 2017, it whiffed on revenue targets and in the following years laid off 100 employees. But by 2020, BuzzFeed was able to diversify its revenue streams (i.e., those addictive <a href="https://www.vox.com/2017/2/14/14594782/buzzfeed-makes-money-from-its-tasty-food-videos-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tasty videos</a>) and turned its first profit since 2014. This year, it won its <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/davidmack/pulitzer-prize-buzzfeed-news-won-china-detention-camps?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first Pulitzer Prize</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, BuzzFeed is in growth mode. Along with SPACing, it's acquiring Complex Networks, another digital publisher that specializes in youth culture, for $300 million.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With the Complex acquisition, BuzzFeed wants to grow revenue to $654 million next year and draw in an even younger, cooler, more intimidating audience.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>BuzzFeed hopes to scoop up more media companies and use that muscle to grab market share from the most powerful throuple in digital ads: Google, Facebook, and Amazon, which accounted for almost 90% of the US digital ad market in 2020, per ad agency GroupM. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>About 1,800 cars have <a href="https://screenrant.com/fast-furious-movies-franchise-cars-destroyed-how-many/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been destroyed</a> in the films of the Fast & Furious franchise, <em>not</em> including the ninth installment, <em>F9</em>, which hits theaters today. Fun fact: Insurance companies use movies like the F&F series to train actuaries on how to calculate loss, per Screen Rant. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“There's millions of pets that are basically a furry annuity for the next decade. And that's unique to our industry. And they're going to give us a tailwind for years to come.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Petco CEO Ron Coughlin is <a href="https://apnews.com/article/health-coronavirus-pandemic-pets-lifestyle-business-923975ec7b193d035b6f048915c87a1d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wagging his tail</a> after Americans spent a record $103.6 billion on their pets last year, up 7% from 2019. He told the AP he expects the pet business to keep booming as people move into larger, suburban houses and workplaces become more pet-friendly.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>David Dobrik was the king of YouTube. Then he went too far. The top four panes are made to look like Microsoft's slanted, rectangular Windows logo, and peeping out through the open part of the window is a swirly blue background.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMicrosoft was incorporated 40 years ago today, but instead of installing a barn door in its master bathroom, the company closed above a $2 trillion market cap for the first time this week and \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/24/22546791/microsoft-windows-11-announcement-features-updates?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunveiled\u003c/a\u003e its first major Windows update in years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWindows 11 is \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/microsoft-unveil-first-new-windows-six-years-2021-06-24/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadding support\u003c/a\u003e for Android apps on its laptops and PCs for the first time and incentivizing developers to put their apps in the Microsoft Store by giving them 100% of revenues from app sales—a swipe at Apple's and Google's 30% fees.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOther updates that should be ready by the time you break out douglas fir candles include....\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAn upgraded interface \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFeatures for multitasking and working across multiple screens \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA direct integration with its messaging/collaboration platform, Teams\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNew gaming features, including an Xbox Game Pass integration\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNot your grandma's operating system\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, actually it is. 35 years after it was first introduced, Windows \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-still-needs-windows-to-shine-11624556362?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremains a core part\u003c/a\u003e of Microsoft's business and is the world's most popular desktop OS. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver 1.3 billion users run Windows 10, CEO Satya Nadella disclosed in May, and the division is expected to bring in $23 billion this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, it can be easy to forget Microsoft is the second-biggest publicly traded company behind Apple. Because of its focus on business software, the company has generally escaped the antitrust scrutiny that lawmakers have leveled on its more consumer-facing peers Facebook, Amazon, Apple, and Google in recent years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e...until now? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSix bills that could reshape antitrust law in the US cleared a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/24/technology/antitrust-overhaul-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor hurdle\u003c/a\u003e yesterday morning. And during debate on one pertaining to data portability, the committee specifically \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/24/us-house-panel-votes-to-give-antitrust-enforcers-more-money-in-big-tech-session.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediscussed\u003c/a\u003e whether the bill had been altered so Microsoft wouldn't fall under its purview. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThese antitrust bills are still in their infancy, but “the House is going faster and farther against tech than anyone expected,” Cowen and Company's Paul Gallant told the NYT. Microsoft, though, doesn't appear to be a priority. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Wanted\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/24/president-biden-group-bipartisan-senators-reach-infrastructure-deal?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Presidential candidate Joe Biden next to an Amtrak train \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODg3L2pvZV9iaWRlbl9hbXRyYWsuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlex Wong/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSomeone must have ordered stuffed-crust pizza during negotiations, because President Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/24/infrastructure-deal-talks-biden-invites-bipartisan-senators-to-white-house.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that he and a bipartisan group of senators agreed to a deal that would put a fresh coat of paint on the country's infrastructure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth sides compromised to reach an agreement. While Biden's \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/biden-releases-23-trillion-infrastructure-plan-boost-us-competitiveness-combat-climate-change?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoriginal proposal\u003c/a\u003e called for $2.3 trillion to combat climate change and overhaul roads, trains, and broadband, the new plan is the stripped-down, acoustic version:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt'll cost $1.2 trillion over eight years with $579 billion in new spending.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe president called it the “largest investment in public transit in American history.” It certainly would be the largest investment into Amtrak since the creation of Amtrak.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome spending on child and elder care as well as education was cut from Biden's original plan. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA corporate tax rate increase to fund the plan, which Biden originally proposed, was also ditched.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003edon't start daydreaming about good train wi-fi yet, the plan still has a ways to go to become law. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said her chamber would only take up the infrastructure plan if Democrats were able to push through a separate spending package. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou'll finally be able to own a piece of the media company that owns a serious chunk of your screen time (we're reusing that line when we IPO). Yesterday, BuzzFeed \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2021/06/24/buzzfeed-to-go-public-with-1-5-billion-spac-deal/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfirmed plans\u003c/a\u003e to go public via SPAC.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory\u003c/strong\u003e: BuzzFeed was founded by CEO Jonah Peretti in 2006 and listicled its way to hundreds of millions in funding from the likes of NBCUniversal. In 2017, it whiffed on revenue targets and in the following years laid off 100 employees. But by 2020, BuzzFeed was able to diversify its revenue streams (i.e., those addictive \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2017/2/14/14594782/buzzfeed-makes-money-from-its-tasty-food-videos-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTasty videos\u003c/a\u003e) and turned its first profit since 2014. This year, it won its \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/davidmack/pulitzer-prize-buzzfeed-news-won-china-detention-camps?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst Pulitzer Prize\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, BuzzFeed is in growth mode. Along with SPACing, it's acquiring Complex Networks, another digital publisher that specializes in youth culture, for $300 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith the Complex acquisition, BuzzFeed wants to grow revenue to $654 million next year and draw in an even younger, cooler, more intimidating audience.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBuzzFeed hopes to scoop up more media companies and use that muscle to grab market share from the most powerful throuple in digital ads: Google, Facebook, and Amazon, which accounted for almost 90% of the US digital ad market in 2020, per ad agency
